comment: Amazing professor, even better person. If you want an incredible classroom experience in which every member of the class contributes to create an elevated learning experience, take Maloni. This class also gives students the opportunity to earn their Lean Six Sigma White and Yellow Belts. Grading is based on quizzes and in class participation.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Maloni is by far one of the best professors I have had at KSU. I got more out of this one class than the rest of them combined last semester. There are 9 open-note quizzes and one computer game-like simulation. His lectures are funny and you can definitely learn a lot about business and supply chain in his class. Highly recommend Maloni and MGT4800
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Respected

comment: One of the best porfessors I had while at KSU! He really cares for his studnets. Only 9 Chapter quizes on top of a simulation that is pretty Easy if you put in the work. Classes are super engaging and Participation is a significant portion of your grade. As long as you show up and just do what he says you will not get a bad grade in his class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Maloni is the best MBA instructor at Kennesaw State University. For that reason, I selected this class (an elective) over many other courses that were being offered. Walking away from his classes you really feel that you get your moneys worth which is different from many of the classes where it appears you can just show up and receive an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Maloni gives 9 quizzes, one after each chapter. They are 10 questions and take 10 minutes. One short answer on each quiz. His lectures are really interesting and the only other grades in the class is a supply chain simulation. If you try you will succeed in this class. Would definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: MGT8200 International Sup Chain Mgmt is not a very interesting subject, most of the topics are from MGT 7040. Prof grading is based on class participation, no value for the quality of the questions, just quantity (number of questions) matters. He uses Links simulation which is not an interesting simulation. He is a machine when it come to grading.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I love that the quizes are one chapter a time. Quizes are 10 min timed with either essays or math homework, but he gives a FULL study outline. No way you can fail him. He is bubbly and outgoing. Easy to talk to. Provides optional help sessions. He does lecture the full 3 hour time with a 10 min break. Overall highly recommend! Take Him!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Maloni is a great professor. If you take him early on you might not understand how good you have it. He makes life easy as long as you show up and participate. The quizzes, although bountiful are straight forward.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I appreciated the bi-weekly quizzes as opposed to exams as I retain information better that way - he gives you exactly what you need to study too so it's hard not to do well. He does require you to participate at least 2 times every class and some individuals took that to the extreme and it could derail class at times. Overall, great class.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Solid MBA professor. His lectures are interesting, relevant to current events, and applicable to our current jobs. Participation heavy and can make or break a student if grade is teetering between letter grades. Overall a great dude and wants his students to succeed. Definitely take him if you get the chance!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Take any class that Maloni teaching and you will learn a lot. He is dedicated to the success of his students. One of the very best professors that I have ever had.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: MGT8040 is OPerations Management class. Lectures are interactive, not monotonous or just him lecturing all the time. There are no 2 hours exams, YAY!! There are pre and post lecture quizzes, which if you attend lectures and take notes, very EASY. Group project: easy! EXTREMELY organized. provides checklists to do before next class. Can't go wrong!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: You have to go to class to pass. 8 quizzes and a project. No exam. He cares a lot about his students. Makes lectures very interesting. Quizzes are easy A if you go to class and take notes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Maloni is a great professor. He does have a specific structure for the class and you must participate which is a double edged sword. Some babble but overall good discussions. There are 8 quizzes, no final and a practice ops simulation. Overall learned a lot and grading was fair. Lighter workload than other classes.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: After mid semester evaluations came out, there were several issues mentioned repeatedly within the class. Maloni just brushed them under the carpet and wasn't willing to change his own teaching strategy to mitigate the largest concern of participation. Allows students to blabber on about irrelevant topics, thus hindering others learning experience.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: The class is an easy A if you come to class. By the way it is mandatory attendance. Maloni is true to his word about participation points. It's easy to participate, and he records it every, single time. I wish this Masters class was more challenging. I have had a wide variety of experiences in my career so the content was a no-brainer.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Maloni's class was great. His lectures are interesting, and easy to pay attention to. GO TO CLASS, participate, do HW, actually pay attention to what he is saying and its an easy A. If you like to skip class, or can't pay attention in class then maybe don't take him. He cares about how students do, easily one of the best professors I've had.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Love taking Mr. Maloni's summer class. I would take his classes if I need it in the future. I wish some of the teachers incorporate the way he teaches into their way. He listens to opinions that are given to him. He tries to work to explain why an answer is that answer. Go to his classes, what he teaches is what is going to be on his quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: 8 tests and around 10 Learnsmarts, one quiz dropped. Only one or two quizzes were actually difficult. For a summer class, it is an easy A/B. Professor Maloni is such a great professor and really wants you to pass. He is funny and caring. Take him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He's very specific about what wants written one his tests. He makes a point not to pile one a bunch of work. He takes the class has a good pace. Took him for summer class and the class is not overwhelming.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Maloni is one of the best professors I have ever had. The material in the class is not extremely demanding, but you will need to study it for the quizzes. He's super straight forward with clear expectations. Attendance and participation are mandatory, but welcome to real life. Would highly recommend this him for any course he offers!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Maloni is awesome, took him for summer operations management. Grades are all quizzes and attendance. He is awesome and his teaching style is perfect. Great guy!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Maloni is an extremely attentive and caring professor. He will always take time to explain material day or night. His course is well structured and is easy to digest. I have yet to have amore engaging professor at the graduate level. You will learn a great deal and you will enjoy it. If you take this teacher, you will not be disappointed.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This class bears a reputation for being difficult or monotonous but Professor Maloni is passionate about his job and does an awesome job of relaying the information in his lectures. His lectures are interactive and it's easy to retain information for the quizzes he gives.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Highly recommend. Never thought I'd have an interest in Operations until I took this class. Not a stressful class since its all quizzes and manageable workload but easy to retain information. Videos and current articles bring real world discussion to the classroom. Take this professor. You'll thank me.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Grade comprised of quizzes (7) and online business simulation. Very enthusiastic about operations management. Brings real world consulting experience to the table. Quiz objectives given before each quiz. Plan to take plenty of notes during his lectures. Makes OM a very interesting topic of study. You will not regret taking Professor Maloni.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Professor is very clear in his expectations. Lays out module objectives for each chapter and teaches to them (while keeping the content relevant through current events and news articles). Quizzes after each chapter based exactly on those same objectives. This is one of those rare classes where it's an easy A but you also learn a lot.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Maloni made my first semester of grad school a positive one. Everything you need to know for this course you learn in class. Very thorough. Keeps class very interesting and drives a lot of conversation. Each chapter had its own quiz which allows you to really master the material before moving on. Project was a simulation that was fun
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor is very clear and specific about what he wants. Occasionally does videos. He does quizzes every other week instead of tests which really takes away pressure. Other than quizzes, there is a project, which for our class is simply a simulation game that is almost fun to do. You really do learn a lot and without much difficulty. Nice Guy too.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: One of the best professors that I have had. He cares a lot about the class and students learning from the class rather than just memorizing. If you do not miss class and pay attention to lectures you will get an at least a B. If you study for 30 minutes the night before quizzes and take good notes you will get an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: 6 quizzes throughout the semester, lowest score dropped. 6 to 8 multiple choices, 2 to 3 short essays. Looks easy but he wants the essays to be exactly what he said in class otherwise he takes points off. Does not explain links simulation at all, no practice rounds. Only says it's hard. No book used, only PowerPoint and lecture notes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Maloni cares for his students but sometimes he can be a bit condescending. He does not explain Links at all, he just tells you that it's hard. No extra credit. Quiz every two weeks. He takes points off if you miss class. Choose a good group for links because it's a  big portion of your grades and very hard. Not an easy A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: LOVED his class. One of the best professors I have ever had at KSU. Take him!!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor EVER. Do not take advantage of his kindness. Go to class and just listen, that is all he wants and you will learn and pass all quizzes. Supply chain simulation project is not easy, but I work in supply chain and found that project to contain applicable skills. He does not give busy work, it is all relative. Genuine, fair, & engaging.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He's so cute! He tries to make class enjoyable and fun. He's never serious or unapproachable. I have social anxiety and I never speak up in class, but it makes the environment so comfortable that it's never really a problem! He wants participation, but even if you say you don't know, he's understanding. KSU needs more professors like him!

This guy is organized! All learning objectives (roughly 10)are agreed upon before the start of each chapter and all testing is over these learning objectives.  This will be the smoothest flowing class you will ever take. JUST PARTICIPATE and be active in conversation for the full participation points portion of your grade.

Professor Maloni gave great lectures that always kept the class pepped up.  He had a great sense of humor and made the subject easy to understand.  Definitely take notes and attend all classes to do well on the tests.  They are very specific multiple choice and a handful of essays.  He also grades participation in class. I would take again.

Very knowledgeable, but maybe a little too passionate about the subject. He puts way more emphasis on class attendance and participation than what is necessary, and be prepared to have to spend A LOT of time on whichever semester project you choose. Tests are from the study guide, but he doesn't use the book, so make sure you take good notes

Dr Maloni is one of the most engaged professors I have ever had.  I didn't think I had an interest in the subject matter going in and now I look forward to exploring it in greater depth.  There's a lot of material but he keeps it moving and is readily available if you need extra help. Overall a great class.

Took the class because it fit my schedule, now I am interested in the field. He was just that good. AMAZING LECTURES & interesting guest speakers. He actually made shipping containers interesting.  This professor does not grade easy, but he does grade fair. He provides everything to succeed if you put the effort into it.  Provides industry contacts

Very knowledgeable and organized. Currently taking as a maymester. 8 daily quizzes 10-12 questions, 6 2-4 question homework assignments and class participation make up the grade. Not too difficult. Definitely reccommend this class.

The class is not difficult. The book is not used, but it is important to take note. Mr. Maloni likes answers to match exactly what he says in class even if the book says otherwise. There are 3 tests, 3 group assignments and  a group simulation. Just study you can get an A. Choose your group members wisely. I would take Mr. Maloni class again.

Very congenial/fun, knowledgeable professor. 3 exams, each made up of MC, Calculations, and short answer sections. Not too difficult, but he grades quite meticulously and often the in-class answers will differ from the textbook answers. Online chapter quizzes and an operations analysis project graded fairly. Weekly participation points required.

Dr. Maloni is one of the best professors I've had at KSU. He provides an excellent outline of the course learning objectives that tells you exactly what you will see on the tests. You will learn a lot.....highly recommended!
test came from power point. he is nice teacher and he is willing to help you if you need help.

Dr. Maloni is the fairest professor there is. Every question on the exam directly corresponds to an objective (he puts the objective number next to the question). You are going to know exactly what to study, but you better know it inside and out as exams are difficult. He may seem mean at first, but he is actually very nice and is trying to be fair
Had him for supply chain and he was great! He was funny made the information fun to learn. Take good notes and study his objectives and you will do fine on his tests!

Found this class very difficult to understand, as the professor does not stay on topic, and does not use the book, nor does he provide notes. Was never sure what to write down and exactly what was going on. Very ineffective teaching style and unfair evaluations.

AWESOME TEACHER!  Tests are based on material learned in class on powerpoints.  He is a fantastic teacher, I highly recommend him.  Best teacher at KSU, extremely helpful and wants everyone to do well.

I enjoyed the class. I found it to be an interested class. His class is a bit difficult, but he is fair. If you are considering studying Statistics or possibly Engineering his class would be very useful.

He is awesome. He grades hard but that is because he knows his stuff. He is very fair on his tests, just watch out for the project, only 1 A (from my understanding) on it. Just participate and study the ppts and you will do fine! side note: he looks angry when he walks in, but dont worry he isnt.

Great Professor!  I took him for Operations Management and Supply Chain Management. Memorizing the slides can get you by, but pay attention if you want an A.  He's a tough grader on the projects, follow his guidelines carefully.  Kind, but fair.  Highly recommend.

Don't bother with book- just use handouts. Tests are tough- but fair.  Study what he tells you to and you'll do fine. Class is interesting- he does tend to get off track though!  Great Prof- highly recommended!

Good prof, very funny and great at teaching. He knows his stuff. Online quizes every week which are hard, 3 tests and he tells you exactly what you will need to know for each one. Group presentation wasnt bad b/c you get to go to a "plant" and explore their business. Participation is a biggie, if you dont speak he will call on you. Def recommend

Mr. Maloni is awesome! He jokes around all the time and most of his jokes are actually funny! His tests are a little bit tough but if you study and do your work you shall do well.  I recommend him to anyone taking this class, attendance is mandatory as is participation but its well worth it.

Well, Maloni is awesome. Not only does he do everything possible to make class fun and interesting, he also teaches well and is extremely helpful. He will forever be one of my favorites at KSU. Take him if you want to learn Operations and get a laugh at the same time. Work hard and ask for feedback from him on your project and you will do well.

Consider sharing a book for some of the problems - you won't need to read it. Lecture style is very straightforward; tests directly from the slides. Entertaining teacher. Extremely well-prepared and organized for every class. Assigns groups members, but it really is a good thing. Low impact kind of project.
You have to work hard in his class but he is very fair. He made this class interesting and I really enjoyed it.
Very Strict in grading. Online class was not all online. Very hard and "business-like" in comments as well as grades.  Not recommended.
Very funny - worth taking his classes just for the entertainment. Grades fairly.

His Tests are directly from his objectives from each chapter.  If you know all of these then you will get an A.  Go to class.  Great teacher.  He made the class worth coming to and is very entertaining.  2 tests worth 20 percent a piece. attendance participation 10%. final 30%.  group project 20%.Tell him global warming is not a proven fact!

very strict with attendance and participation. Tests questions come from powerpoint notes,1 page short answer, one page multiple choice and one page  problems (a few are a little tricky).  Hes very sarcastic but entertaining. dont miss class or be late, he will call you out and talk about you when your gone.
